definitions.definition: the part of the earth's surface that is not covered by water, as opposed to the sea or the air.
examples: the reptiles lay their eggs on land
synonyms: shore "the lookout sighted land to the east"

definitions.definition: living or traveling on land rather than in water or the air.
an expanse of land; an area of ground, especially in terms of its ownership or use.
ground or soil used as a basis for agriculture.

examples: the valley is one of the most beautiful in the land
synonyms: domain "Tunisia is a land of variety"

examples: you are living in a fantasy land

definitions.definition: the space between the rifling grooves in a gun.
put (someone or something) on land from a boat.
examples: the lifeboat landed the survivors safely ashore
the marines landed at a small fishing jetty
synonyms: get off "Canadian troops landed at Juno Beach"

definitions.definition: bring (a fish) to land, especially with a net or hook.
examples: I landed a scrappy three-pound walleye

definitions.definition: succeed in obtaining or achieving (something desirable), especially in the face of strong competition.
examples: she landed the starring role in a new film
synonyms: carry off; informalbag "Nick landed the job of editor"

definitions.definition: come down through the air and alight on the ground.
examples: planes landing at the rate of two a minute
synonyms: come down More"their plane landed in Chicago"perch
alight "a bird landed on the branch"

definitions.definition: bring (an aircraft or spacecraft) to the ground or the surface of water, especially in a controlled way.
reach the ground after falling or jumping.
examples: he leaped over the fence and landed nimbly on his feet

definitions.definition: (of an object) come to rest after falling or being thrown.
examples: the plate landed in her lap

definitions.definition: (of something unpleasant or unexpected) arrive suddenly.
examples: there seemed to be more problems than ever landing on her desk this week

definitions.definition: cause someone to be in (a difficult or unwelcome situation).
examples: his exploits always landed him in trouble
synonyms: cause to be in "Joanne's drug habit landed her in big trouble"

definitions.definition: inflict (an unwelcome task or a difficult situation) on someone.
examples: the mistake landed the company with a massive bill
I won the fight without landing a single punch
synonyms: mete out "he landed a left hook that staggered Curry"
